intro: Polycarpaea spirostylis subsp. densiflora, commonly known as the dense-flowered spirostylis, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in summer. The subspecies is native to southern Africa, particularly in regions with well-drained soils. It produces numerous small, hairy leaves and has a woody base, which contributes to its resilience in arid environments. This plant is often found in rocky or sandy habitats and is valued for its ornamental appeal.
